body_html:
Thanks for the note, Ray.
…
On Fri, Nov 3, 2017 at 7:20 AM, Ray Wang ***@***.***> wrote: @MichaelCaraccio <https://github.com/michaelcaraccio> Since I run my project with python2, I change this command to pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-py2-none-any.whl and it works well. But according to my test, this only occurs when I use linuxbrew installed python. Everything works fine if I use pyenv installed python even if they are the same version 2.7.14, weird.. Anyway, thank you! — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#6533 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ALBz712vG87hv6-A64gFPV9i27TnN3jGks5syvcLgaJpZM4LWtr2> .

body_text:
Thanks for the note, Ray.
…
On Fri, Nov 3, 2017 at 7:20 AM, Ray Wang ***@***.***> wrote:
 @MichaelCaraccio <https://github.com/michaelcaraccio> Since I run my
 project with python2, I change this command to

 pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-py2-none-any.whl

 and it works well. But according to my test, this only occurs when I use
 linuxbrew installed python. Everything works fine if I use pyenv installed
 python even if they are the same version 2.7.14, weird..

 Anyway, thank you!

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.

body:
Thanks for the note, Ray.

On Fri, Nov 3, 2017 at 7:20 AM, Ray Wang <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @MichaelCaraccio <https://github.com/michaelcaraccio> Since I run my
> project with python2, I change this command to
>
> pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-py2-none-any.whl
>
> and it works well. But according to my test, this only occurs when I use
> linuxbrew installed python. Everything works fine if I use pyenv installed
> python even if they are the same version 2.7.14, weird..
>
> Anyway, thank you!
>
